maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet deactivates the workload management feature on the specified cluster.
This cmdlet deactivates the workload management feature on the cluster. This operation tears down the Kubernetes instance and the worker nodes associated with the cluster.
Specifies the cluster whose workload management functionality you want to deactivate.

Indicates that the command returns immediately without waiting for the task to complete. In this mode, the output of the cmdlet is a Task object. For more information about the RunAsync parameter, run "help About_RunAsync" in the VMware PowerCLI console.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

Indicates that the command returns immediately without waiting for the task to complete. In this mode, the output of the cmdlet is a Task object. For more information about the RunAsync parameter, run "help About_RunAsync" in the VMware PowerCLI console.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the cluster whose workload management functionality you want to deactivate.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deactivates the workload management on a cluster named "WorkloadManagementCluster".

maml:description.maml:para: Enables the workload management feature on the specified cluster.

Enables the workload management feature on the specified cluster. As a prerequisite, you must establish a connection to a vCenter Server system by using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet. Starting with vSphere 7.0 Update 1, you can use two options for network backing: the NXT-T Container Plugin and the vSphere networking stack. For more information, see Configuring and Managing a Supervisor Cluster (https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-21ABC792-0A23-40EF-8D37-0367B483585E.html)
Specifies the cluster where you want to enable the workload management feature.
Indicates the specification(s) for the additional namespace network(s) to be created. The additional namespace networks can later be utilized by the workloads.
Specifies a timeout in seconds to wait for the operation to complete. The default timeout is 1 hour.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the content library which holds the virtual machine images for the workload management feature.
Specifies the port of the container image registry that is used by the cluster. If not specified, the default one is 443.
Specifies the IP address or the host name of the container image registry that is used by the cluster.
Specifies the name of the default image repository in the specified registry that is used by the cluster.
Specifies the storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods in the cluster.
Specifies a list of IP address ranges that will be used to derive frontend IP addresses for L4 virtual servers in the format "192.169.10.100-192.169.10.150". You must provide at least one range.
Specifies a list of addresses for the data plane API servers used to configure virtual servers in the following formats: "FQDN:port" or "IPAddress:port".

Specifies a unique name across all namespaces in a vCenter server system that is used to identify the load balancer configuration object to be created. This must be an alphanumeric (a-z and 0-9) string, with a maximum length of 63 characters. You can use the hyphen (-) anywhere except for the first or last symbol.
Specifies the password for the HAProxy Data Plane administrator user.
Specifies a PEM-encoded Certificate Authority Chain which is used to verify x509 certificates received from the server.

See the following example script that extracts the value for this parameter from the virtual machine where the HAProxy is deployed. [https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-8D7D292B-43E9-4CB8-9E20-E4039B80BF9B.html]
$vc_user = "administrator@vsphere.local"
$vc_password = "PASSWORD"
Connect-VIServer -User $vc_user -Password $vc_password -Server $vc
$VMname = "haproxy-demo"
$AdvancedSettingName = "guestinfo.dataplaneapi.cacert"
$Base64cert = get-vm $VMname |Get-AdvancedSetting -Name $AdvancedSettingName
while ([string]::IsNullOrEmpty($Base64cert.Value)) {
Write-Host "Waiting for CA Cert Generation... This may take a under 5-10
minutes as the VM needs to boot and generate the CA Cert
(if you haven't provided one already)."
$Base64cert = get-vm $VMname |Get-AdvancedSetting -Name $AdvancedSettingName
Start-sleep -seconds 2
Write-Host "CA Cert Found... Converting from BASE64"
$cert = [Text.Encoding]::Utf8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String($Base64cert.Value))
Write-Host $cert
Specifies an administrator user name to access the HAProxy Data Plane API server.
Specifies the storage policy associated with the storage that you want to use for container images.
Specifies the disclaimer that you want to be displayed before logging in through the Kubectl plugin.

Specifies the length of the IP address range used for network interfaces on the management network. If not specified, the value of 5 is assumed. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the floating IP used by the HA master cluster in the DHCP case. This parameter is optional and it's only relevant when the value of the network mode is DHCP.
Specifies the IPv4 address of the gateway for the management network. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the type of network configuration used for the network adapters attached to the management network.

Specifies the starting IP address in the range of IP addresses used for network interfaces on the management network. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the subnet mask of the management network. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the port group or opaque network to which the management network interface of the Kubernetes API server is attached.

Specifies a list of additional DNS names to associate with the Kubernetes API server. These DNS names are embedded in the Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate presented by the API server. If not specified, no additional DNS names are embedded in the TLS certificate.

Specifies a list of domains (for example "vmware.com") that you want to search when trying to look up a host name on Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference. If not specified, no default DNS search domains are set.
Specifies a list of DNS server IP addresses that you want to use on the Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference. If not specified, no default DNS servers are set.

Specifies a list of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses that you want to use on the Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference. If not specified, VMware Tools based time synchronization is enabled.
Specifies the storage policy associated with the Kubernetes API server.

Indicates a specification for the primary workload network to be created. The primary network handles the traffic for the Kubernetes control plane VMs and for the Kubernetes workloads. Namespaces that do not have a different port group assigned as their network use the primary network. Tanzu Kubernetes clusters use only the network that is assigned to the namespace where they are deployed or the primary network if there is no network assigned to that namespace.

Indicates that the command returns immediately without waiting for the task to complete. In this mode, the output of the cmdlet is a Task object. For more information about the RunAsync parameter, run "help About_RunAsync" in the VMware PowerCLI console.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

Specifies a CIDR block from which Kubernetes allocates service cluster IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ExternalIngressCIDRs, ExternalEgressCIDRs, or other services that run in the data center. The value is formatted as IPv4NetworkAddress/PrefixInteger. For example, you can use this to represent 256 IP addresses using the value of "10.10.10.0/24".
Specifies the expected size and resources allocated to the Kubernetes API server and the worker nodes.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

Specifies external DNS servers that you want to expose to the workloads. These DNS servers serve as the default fallback DNS servers to resolve domain names hosted outside of the Supervisor Cluster. If not specified, no default DNS servers are set.
Specifies the cluster where you want to enable the workload management feature.
Specifies a timeout in seconds to wait for the operation to complete. The default timeout is 1 hour.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the content library which holds the virtual machine images for the workload management feature.
Specifies the port of the container image registry that is used by the cluster. If not specified, the default one is 443.
Specifies the IP address or the host name of the container image registry that is used by the cluster.
Specifies the name of the default image repository in the specified registry that is used by the cluster.
Specifies the vSphere distributed switch used to connect this cluster to the overlay transport zone. In order to run this command, you must configure the switch in NSX-T in advance.
Specifies the storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods in the cluster.

Specifies the Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing Source Network Address Translation (SNAT) from container IPs to external IPs. These ranges should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ServiceCIDR, ExternalIngressCIDRs, or other services that run in the data center. The value is formatted as IPv4NetworkAddress/PrefixInteger. For example, you can use this to represent 256 IP addresses using the value of "10.10.10.0/24".

Specifies CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. These ranges should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ServiceCIDR, ExternalEgressCIDRs, or other services that run in the data center.
Specifies the storage policy associated with the storage that you want to use for container images.
Specifies the disclaimer that you want to be displayed before logging in through the Kubectl plugin.

Specifies the length of the IP address range used for network interfaces on the management network. If not specified, the value of 5 is assumed. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the floating IP used by the HA master cluster in the DHCP case. This parameter is optional and it's only relevant when the value of the network mode is DHCP.
Specifies the IPv4 address of the gateway for the management network. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the type of network configuration used for the network adapters attached to the management network.

Specifies the starting IP address in the range of IP addresses used for network interfaces on the management network. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the subnet mask of the management network. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the port group or opaque network to which the management network interface of the Kubernetes API server is attached.

Specifies a list of additional DNS names to associate with the Kubernetes API server. These DNS names are embedded in the Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate presented by the API server. If not specified, no additional DNS names are embedded in the TLS certificate.

Specifies a list of domains (for example "vmware.com") that you want to search when trying to look up a host name on Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference. If not specified, no default DNS search domains are set.
Specifies a list of DNS server IP addresses that you want to use on the Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference. If not specified, no default DNS servers are set.

Specifies a list of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses that you want to use on the Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference. If not specified, VMware Tools based time synchronization is enabled.
Specifies the storage policy associated with the Kubernetes API server.
Specifies the ID of the NSX Edge cluster that you want to use for Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer, Kubernetes Ingresses, and NSX SNAT.
Specifies an NSX-T distributed switch used to connect this cluster to the overlay transport zone.

Specifies CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates Pod IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in ServiceCIDRs, ExternalIngressCIDRs, ExternalEgressCIDRs, or other services that run in the data center. All Pod CIDR blocks must be of at least subnet size /23.

Indicates that the command returns immediately without waiting for the task to complete. In this mode, the output of the cmdlet is a Task object. For more information about the RunAsync parameter, run "help About_RunAsync" in the VMware PowerCLI console.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

Specifies a CIDR block from which Kubernetes allocates service cluster IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ExternalIngressCIDRs, ExternalEgressCIDRs, or other services that run in the data center. The value is formatted as IPv4NetworkAddress/PrefixInteger. For example, you can use this to represent 256 IP addresses using the value of "10.10.10.0/24".
Specifies the expected size and resources allocated to the Kubernetes API server and the worker nodes.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

Specifies external DNS servers that you want to expose to the workloads. These DNS servers serve as the default fallback DNS servers to resolve domain names hosted outside of the Supervisor Cluster. If not specified, no default DNS servers are set.
Indicates the specification(s) for the additional namespace network(s) to be created. The additional namespace networks can later be utilized by the workloads.
Specifies the cluster where you want to enable the workload management feature.
Specifies a timeout in seconds to wait for the operation to complete. The default timeout is 1 hour.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the content library which holds the virtual machine images for the workload management feature.
Specifies the port of the container image registry that is used by the cluster. If not specified, the default one is 443.
Specifies the IP address or the host name of the container image registry that is used by the cluster.
Specifies the name of the default image repository in the specified registry that is used by the cluster.
Specifies the vSphere distributed switch used to connect this cluster to the overlay transport zone. In order to run this command, you must configure the switch in NSX-T in advance.
Specifies the storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods in the cluster.

Specifies the Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing Source Network Address Translation (SNAT) from container IPs to external IPs. These ranges should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ServiceCIDR, ExternalIngressCIDRs, or other services that run in the data center. The value is formatted as IPv4NetworkAddress/PrefixInteger. For example, you can use this to represent 256 IP addresses using the value of "10.10.10.0/24".

Specifies CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. These ranges should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ServiceCIDR, ExternalEgressCIDRs, or other services that run in the data center.
Specifies a list of IP address ranges that will be used to derive frontend IP addresses for L4 virtual servers in the format "192.169.10.100-192.169.10.150". You must provide at least one range.
Specifies a list of addresses for the data plane API servers used to configure virtual servers in the following formats: "FQDN:port" or "IPAddress:port".

Specifies a unique name across all namespaces in a vCenter server system that is used to identify the load balancer configuration object to be created. This must be an alphanumeric (a-z and 0-9) string, with a maximum length of 63 characters. You can use the hyphen (-) anywhere except for the first or last symbol.
Specifies the password for the HAProxy Data Plane administrator user.
Specifies a PEM-encoded Certificate Authority Chain which is used to verify x509 certificates received from the server.

See the following example script that extracts the value for this parameter from the virtual machine where the HAProxy is deployed. [https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-8D7D292B-43E9-4CB8-9E20-E4039B80BF9B.html]
$vc_user = "administrator@vsphere.local"
$vc_password = "PASSWORD"
Connect-VIServer -User $vc_user -Password $vc_password -Server $vc
$VMname = "haproxy-demo"
$AdvancedSettingName = "guestinfo.dataplaneapi.cacert"
$Base64cert = get-vm $VMname |Get-AdvancedSetting -Name $AdvancedSettingName
while ([string]::IsNullOrEmpty($Base64cert.Value)) {
Write-Host "Waiting for CA Cert Generation... This may take a under 5-10
minutes as the VM needs to boot and generate the CA Cert
(if you haven't provided one already)."
$Base64cert = get-vm $VMname |Get-AdvancedSetting -Name $AdvancedSettingName
Start-sleep -seconds 2
Write-Host "CA Cert Found... Converting from BASE64"
$cert = [Text.Encoding]::Utf8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String($Base64cert.Value))
Write-Host $cert
Specifies an administrator user name to access the HAProxy Data Plane API server.
Specifies the storage policy associated with the storage that you want to use for container images.
Specifies the disclaimer that you want to be displayed before logging in through the Kubectl plugin.

Specifies the length of the IP address range used for network interfaces on the management network. If not specified, the value of 5 is assumed. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the floating IP used by the HA master cluster in the DHCP case. This parameter is optional and it's only relevant when the value of the network mode is DHCP.
Specifies the IPv4 address of the gateway for the management network. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the type of network configuration used for the network adapters attached to the management network.

Specifies the starting IP address in the range of IP addresses used for network interfaces on the management network. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the subnet mask of the management network. This parameter is only relevant when the value of the network mode is StaticRange.
Specifies the port group or opaque network to which the management network interface of the Kubernetes API server is attached.

Specifies a list of additional DNS names to associate with the Kubernetes API server. These DNS names are embedded in the Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate presented by the API server. If not specified, no additional DNS names are embedded in the TLS certificate.

Specifies a list of domains (for example "vmware.com") that you want to search when trying to look up a host name on Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference. If not specified, no default DNS search domains are set.
Specifies a list of DNS server IP addresses that you want to use on the Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference. If not specified, no default DNS servers are set.

Specifies a list of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses that you want to use on the Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference. If not specified, VMware Tools based time synchronization is enabled.
Specifies the storage policy associated with the Kubernetes API server.
Specifies the ID of the NSX Edge cluster that you want to use for Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer, Kubernetes Ingresses, and NSX SNAT.
Specifies an NSX-T distributed switch used to connect this cluster to the overlay transport zone.

Specifies CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates Pod IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in ServiceCIDRs, ExternalIngressCIDRs, ExternalEgressCIDRs, or other services that run in the data center. All Pod CIDR blocks must be of at least subnet size /23.

Indicates a specification for the primary workload network to be created. The primary network handles the traffic for the Kubernetes control plane VMs and for the Kubernetes workloads. Namespaces that do not have a different port group assigned as their network use the primary network. Tanzu Kubernetes clusters use only the network that is assigned to the namespace where they are deployed or the primary network if there is no network assigned to that namespace.

Indicates that the command returns immediately without waiting for the task to complete. In this mode, the output of the cmdlet is a Task object. For more information about the RunAsync parameter, run "help About_RunAsync" in the VMware PowerCLI console.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

Specifies a CIDR block from which Kubernetes allocates service cluster IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ExternalIngressCIDRs, ExternalEgressCIDRs, or other services that run in the data center. The value is formatted as IPv4NetworkAddress/PrefixInteger. For example, you can use this to represent 256 IP addresses using the value of "10.10.10.0/24".
Specifies the expected size and resources allocated to the Kubernetes API server and the worker nodes.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

Specifies external DNS servers that you want to expose to the workloads. These DNS servers serve as the default fallback DNS servers to resolve domain names hosted outside of the Supervisor Cluster. If not specified, no default DNS servers are set.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enables the workload management feature on the "MyCluster" cluster by using the NSX-T Container Plugin. The management interfaces is attached to the network "ManagementNetwork". The management interfaces use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) to configure its network stack. The vSphere distributed switch "NsxSwitch" provides the overlay networking. You must configure that switch in NSX-T to provide that prior to executing the above example. The NSX edge cluster with ID "a19ea5ea-3817-4394-83a7-55e4962c90f1" provides any higher level network functions that the vCenter system consumes in order to host the workloads.

Enables the workload management feature on the "MyCluster" cluster by using the NSX-T Container Plugin. The management interfaces are attached to the network "ManagementNetwork". The management interfaces use static network configuration. The NSX-T distributed switch "my-nvds" provides the overlay networking. You must configure that switch in NSX-T in advance to provide that prior to executing the above example. The NSX edge cluster with ID "a19ea5ea-3817-4394-83a7-55e4962c90f1" provides any higher level network functions that the vCenter system consumes in order to host the workloads.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-Cluster "MyCluster" | Enable-WMCluster ` -SizeHint Tiny ` -ManagementVirtualNetwork (Get-VirtualNetwork "ManagementNetwork" ) ` -ManagementNetworkMode Dhcp ` -ManagementNetworkFloatingIPAddress "10.23.78.20" ` -ServiceCIDR "10.96.0.0/24" ` -EphemeralStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy1" ` -ImageStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy2" ` -MasterStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy3" ` -ContentLibrary "MyContentLibrary" ` -HAProxyName "HAProxy1" ` -HAProxyAddressRanges "192.168.10.50-192.168.10.99" ` -HAProxyUsername "HAProxy1AdminUser" ` -HAProxyPassword "pass" ` -HAProxyDataPlaneAddresses "HAProxy1DataPlane:5556" ` -HAProxyServerCertificateChain "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----...........-----END CERTIFICATE-----" ` -PrimaryWorkloadNetworkSpecification ( New-WMNamespaceNetworkSpec ` -Name "network-1" ` -Gateway "192.168.10.1" ` -Subnet "255.255.255.0" ` -AddressRanges "192.168.10.100-192.168.10.200" ` -DistributedPortGroup "MyPortgroup" ` )

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enables the workload management feature on the "MyCluster" cluster by using the vSphere networking stack.
As a prerequisite for the script, you must configure the management network and distributed portgroup(s).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$primaryWorkloadNetwork = New-WMNamespaceNetworkSpec ` -Name "network-1" ` -Gateway "192.168.10.1" ` -Subnet "255.255.255.0" ` -AddressRanges "192.168.10.50-192.168.10.99" ` -DistributedPortGroup "WM-Management Network"
$additionalWorkloadNetwork1 = New-WMNamespaceNetworkSpec ` -Name "network-1" ` -Gateway "192.168.10.1" ` -Subnet "255.255.255.0" ` -AddressRanges "192.168.10.100-192.168.10.149" ` -DistributedPortGroup "WM-Management Network"
$additionalWorkloadNetwork2 = New-WMNamespaceNetworkSpec ` -Name "network-1" ` -Gateway "192.168.10.1" ` -Subnet "255.255.255.0" ` -AddressRanges "192.168.10.50-192.168.150.200" ` -DistributedPortGroup "WM-Management Network"
Get-Cluster "MyCluster" | Enable-WMCluster ` -SizeHint Tiny ` -ManagementVirtualNetwork (Get-VirtualNetwork "ManagementNetwork" ) ` -ManagementNetworkMode Dhcp ` -ManagementNetworkFloatingIPAddress "10.23.78.20" ` -ServiceCIDR "10.96.0.0/24" ` -EphemeralStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy1" ` -ImageStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy2" ` -MasterStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy3" ` -ContentLibrary "MyContentLibrary" ` -HAProxyName "HAProxy1" ` -HAProxyAddressRanges "192.168.10.50-192.168.10.99" ` -HAProxyUsername "HAProxy1AdminUser" ` -HAProxyPassword "pass" ` -HAProxyDataPlaneAddresses "HAProxy1DataPlane:5556" ` -HAProxyServerCertificateChain "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----...........-----END CERTIFICATE-----" ` -PrimaryWorkloadNetworkSpecification $primaryWorkloadNetwork ` -AdditionalWorkloadNetworkSpecifications $additionalWorkloadNetwork1, $additionalWorkloadNetwork2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enables the workload management feature on the "MyCluster" cluster by using the vSphere networking stack. First, use the New-WMNamespaceNetworkSpec cmdlet to create specifications for the namespace networks. Second, use the Enable-WMCluster cmdlet to create the specified namespace networks - one primary and two additional ones - which can later be utilized by the workloads.
As a prerequisite for the script, you must configure the management network and distributed portgroup(s).

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves the configuration for the workload management feature of the clusters in the vCenter Server system.

This cmdlet retrieves the configuration for the workload management feature of the clusters in the vCenter Server system. It also requires a connection to the vCenter Server system by using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the cluster whose configuration you want to retrieve.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the cluster whose configuration you want to retrieve.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the configuration for the workload management feature for all clusters in the vCenter Server system.
Retrieves the configuration for the workload management feature for the cluster called "MyCluster".
Retrieves the configuration for the workload management feature for the cluster called "MyCluster".

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves the workload namespaces in the vCenter Server system.
This cmdlet retrieves the workload namespaces in the vCenter Server system and requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a set of IDs of the workload namespaces. The ID is also equal to the name of the workload namespace.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a set of filters for the names of the workload namespaces.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a set of IDs of the workload namespaces. The ID is also equal to the name of the workload namespace.
Specifies a set of filters for the names of the workload namespaces.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all workload namespaces in the vCenter Server system.
Retrieves all workload namespaces that match the filter specified for the Name parameter.
Retrieves the workload namespace with the specified ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves information about the Kubernetes resource limits of a namespace.
Retrieves information about the Kubernetes resource limits of a namespace.
Specifies the workload management namespace whose resource limits to retrieve.

Specifies the vCenter Server(s) on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is specified to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the workload management namespace whose resource limits to retrieve.

Specifies the vCenter Server(s) on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is specified to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the resource limits for the "dev" namespace.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves information about workload namespace access permissions.
Retrieves information about workload namespace access permissions.
Specifies the workload namespaces whose access permissions you want to retrieve.
Specifies a filter for the Domain property of the access permissions you want to retrieve.
Specifies a filter for the PrincipalName property of the access permissions you want to retrieve.

Specifies the vCenter Server(s) on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is specified to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a filter for the Domain property of the access permissions you want to retrieve.
Specifies the workload namespaces whose access permissions you want to retrieve.
Specifies a filter for the PrincipalName property of the access permissions you want to retrieve.

Specifies the vCenter Server(s) on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is specified to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all the access control permissions for the workload namespace with name "Development".
Retrieves the access control permissions for the "Development" namespace for users or groups from the domain "MyCorpDomain" whose PrincipalName starts with "Alice".

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves the configuration of the storage claimed by a workload namespace.

This cmdlet retrieves the storage configuration claimed by a workload namespace. The storage claim is expressed as a storage policy and parameters of the claim. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a set of WMNamespace objects for which you want to retrieve the configuration.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a set of WMNamespace objects for which you want to retrieve the configuration.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the configuration of the storage claimed by the namespace called "MyNamespace".
Retrieves the configuration of the storage claimed by all namespaces in the vCenter Server system.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet creates a new workload namespace on the specified cluster.

This cmdlet creates a new workload namespace on the specified cluster. The specified cluster must have workloads feature enabled. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the cluster where the workloads in this namespace will run.
Specifies the description of the workload namespace.
Specifies the name of the workload cluster. The value must be a valid kubernetes identifier.

Indicates that the command returns immediately without waiting for the task to complete. In this mode, the output of the cmdlet is a Task object. For more information about the RunAsync parameter, run "help About_RunAsync" in the VMware PowerCLI console.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the cluster where the workloads in this namespace will run.
Specifies the description of the workload namespace.
Specifies the name of the workload cluster. The value must be a valid kubernetes identifier.

Indicates that the command returns immediately without waiting for the task to complete. In this mode, the output of the cmdlet is a Task object. For more information about the RunAsync parameter, run "help About_RunAsync" in the VMware PowerCLI console.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a workload namespace called "MyNamespace" on the "MyWMCluster" cluster.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a specification for a namespace network. The specification is later used to create the actual namespace network.
Creates a specification for a namespace network. The specification is later used to create the actual namespace network.
Specifies one or more strings representing an IP address range in the format "start IP - end IP". For example, "192.169.10.100 - 192.169.10.200".
Specifies the distributed portgroup that handles the Kubernetes workload traffic.
Specifies the gateway of the network.

Specifies a unique name within the cluster. This must be an alphanumeric (a-z and 0-9) string, with a maximum length of 63 characters. You can use the hyphen (-) anywhere except for the first or last symbol.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the subnet mask of the network.
Specifies one or more strings representing an IP address range in the format "start IP - end IP". For example, "192.169.10.100 - 192.169.10.200".
Specifies the distributed portgroup that handles the Kubernetes workload traffic.
Specifies the gateway of the network.

Specifies a unique name within the cluster. This must be an alphanumeric (a-z and 0-9) string, with a maximum length of 63 characters. You can use the hyphen (-) anywhere except for the first or last symbol.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the subnet mask of the network.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$primaryWorkloadNetworkSpec = New-WMNamespaceNetworkSpec ` -Name "network-1" ` -Gateway "192.168.10.1" ` -Subnet "255.255.255.0" ` -AddressRanges "192.168.10.50-192.168.10.99" ` -DistributedPortGroup "Management Network"
Get-Cluster "MyCluster" | Enable-WMCluster ` -SizeHint Tiny ` -ManagementVirtualNetwork (Get-VirtualNetwork "VM Network" ) ` -ManagementNetworkMode Dhcp ` -ServiceCIDR "10.96.0.0/24" ` -EphemeralStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy1" ` -ImageStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy2" ` -MasterStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy3" ` -ContentLibrary "cl1" ` -HAProxyName "HAProxy1" ` -HAProxyAddressRanges "192.168.10.50-192.168.10.99" ` -HAProxyUsername "HAProxy1AdminUser" ` -HAProxyPassword "pass" ` -HAProxyDataPlaneAddresses "HAProxy1DataPlane:443" ` -HAProxyServerCertificateChain "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----...........-----END CERTIFICATE-----" ` -PrimaryWorkloadNetworkSpecification $primaryWorkloadNetworkSpec

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a specification for a workspace network backed by a distributed portgroup. The specification is then passed to Enable-WMCluster which creates a namespace network that can later be used by the workloads.

maml:description.maml:para: Grants an access permission to a workload namespace.
Grants an access permission to a workload namespace.
Specifies the workload namespace to grant access to.
Specifies the user's domain. For local users - specify "localos".
Specifies the name of the user or group.
Specifies the type of the security principal - either a user or a group.
Specifies the role that you want to grant to the user or group.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the user's domain. For local users - specify "localos".
Specifies the workload namespace to grant access to.
Specifies the name of the user or group.
Specifies the type of the security principal - either a user or a group.
Specifies the role that you want to grant to the user or group.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-WMNamespacePermission Development -Role Edit -Domain localos -PrincipalType User -PrincipalName Alice

dev:remarks.maml:para: Grants the user Alice an 'Edit' access to the Development namespace.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet creates a storage claim for a workload namespace using the specified configuration.

This cmdlet creates a storage claim for a workload namespace using the specified configuration. The storage claim is expressed as a storage policy and parameters of the claim. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the limit on the storage used by workloads running in the specified workload namespace.
Specifies the workload namespace that you want to use the storage.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the storage policy that you want to apply to the storage used by the specified workload namespace.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the limit on the storage used by workloads running in the specified workload namespace.
Specifies the workload namespace that you want to use the storage.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the storage policy that you want to apply to the storage used by the specified workload namespace.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a storage claim for the workload namespace "MyNamespace". The storage policy "MyStoragePolicy" would be applied to the storage used by workloads running in this workload namespace. There would be no limit on the storage used by those workloads.

Creates a storage claim for the workload namespace "MyNamespace". The storage policy "MyStoragePolicy" would be applied to the storage used by workloads running in this workload namespace. There would a limit of 2048 MiB on the storage used by those workloads.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet deletes a workload namespace from the vCenter Server system.
This cmdlet deletes a workload namespace from the vCenter Server system. The cmdlet requires a connection to a vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the workload namespaces that you want to delete.

Indicates that the command returns immediately without waiting for the task to complete. In this mode, the output of the cmdlet is a Task object. For more information about the RunAsync parameter, run "help About_RunAsync" in the VMware PowerCLI console.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the workload namespaces that you want to delete.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes a workload namespace called "MyNamespace".
Deletes all workload namespaces that have a name that matches the "Target*" pattern (i.e. begins with "Target").

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an access permission to a workload namespace.
Removes an access permission to a workload namespace.
Specifies the access permissions that you want to remove.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the access permissions that you want to remove.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Revokes the access permission of the user Alice to the Development workload namespace.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet deletes the storage claim for a workload namespace associated with a specified storage policy.

This cmdlet deletes the storage claim for a workload namespace associated with a specified storage policy. Pods, that use persistent storage from the earlier version of storage policies, can access them till the datastores are attached to the worker nodes. To get the existing storage claims, see the Get-WMNamespaceStoragePolicy cmdlet. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the storage claims that you want to remove.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the storage claims that you want to remove.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes a storage claim for the workload namespace "MyNamespace" associated with the "MyStoragePolicy" storage policy.
Deletes a storage claim for the workload namespace "MyNamespace" associated with the "MyStoragePolicy" storage policy.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet modifies the workload settings of a Tanzu Kubernetes Grid cluster.
This cmdlet modifies the configuration of a Tanzu Kubernetes Grid cluster. Only the specified settings are changed and the rest of the configuration remains as it is.
Specifies the workload management cluster whose configuration you want to update.

Specifies the certificate that the Tanzu Kubernetes API server uses. You must create the certificate by signing the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) obtained from com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.certificates.Request.create.
Specifies the content library which holds the virtual machine images for the Tanzu Kubernetes Grid Service.
Specifies the IP address or the host name of the container image registry.
Specifies the port number of the container image registry. If unset, the default value is 443.
Specifies the default image repository that you want to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name.
Specifies the PEM-encoded Х.509 certificate that you want to use by NSX as a default fallback certificate for Tanzu Kubernetes Ingress Services.
Specifies the storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods in the cluster.

Specifies the classless inter-domain routing (CIDR) blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing source network address translation (SNAT) from container IPs to external IPs. These ranges should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ServiceCIDR, IngressCIDRs, or other services running in the data center. The value is formatted as IPv4NetworkAddress/PrefixInteger. For example, this can be used to represent 256 IP addresses using the "10.10.10.0/24" value.

Specifies the CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. These ranges should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ServiceCIDR, EgressCIDRs, or other services running in the data center.
Specifies the storage policy associated with the storage that you want to use for the container images.
Specifies the disclaimer that you want to be displayed before logging in through the vSphere Plugin for kubectl.
Specifies the list of domains (for example "vmware.com") that you want to search when trying to look up a host name on the Tanzu Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference.
Specifies the list of Domain Name System (DNS) server IP addresses that you want to use on the Tanzu Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference.
Specifies the list of Network Time Protocol (NTP) server DNS names or IP addresses that you want to use on the Tanzu Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference.
Specifies the storage policy associated with the Tanzu Kubernetes API server.

Specifies the CIDR blocks from which Tanzu Kubernetes allocates pod IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in ServiceCIDRs, IngressCIDRs, EgressCIDRs, or other services running in the data center. All Pod CIDR blocks must be of at least subnet size /23.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a hint about what size and resources to allocate to the Tanzu Kubernetes API server and the worker nodes.

Specifies the external DNS servers that you want to expose to the workloads. These DNS servers serve as the default fallback DNS servers to resolve domain names hosted outside of the Supervisor Cluster.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

Specifies the certificate that the Tanzu Kubernetes API server uses. You must create the certificate by signing the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) obtained from com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.certificates.Request.create.
Specifies the content library which holds the virtual machine images for the Tanzu Kubernetes Grid Service.
Specifies the IP address or the host name of the container image registry.
Specifies the port number of the container image registry. If unset, the default value is 443.
Specifies the default image repository that you want to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name.
Specifies the PEM-encoded Х.509 certificate that you want to use by NSX as a default fallback certificate for Tanzu Kubernetes Ingress Services.
Specifies the storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods in the cluster.

Specifies the classless inter-domain routing (CIDR) blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing source network address translation (SNAT) from container IPs to external IPs. These ranges should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ServiceCIDR, IngressCIDRs, or other services running in the data center. The value is formatted as IPv4NetworkAddress/PrefixInteger. For example, this can be used to represent 256 IP addresses using the "10.10.10.0/24" value.

Specifies the CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. These ranges should not overlap with those in PodCIDRs, ServiceCIDR, EgressCIDRs, or other services running in the data center.

Specifies the list of Network Time Protocol (NTP) server DNS names or IP addresses that you want to use on the Tanzu Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference.

Specifies the CIDR blocks from which Tanzu Kubernetes allocates pod IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in ServiceCIDRs, IngressCIDRs, EgressCIDRs, or other services running in the data center. All Pod CIDR blocks must be of at least subnet size /23.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

Specifies the workload management cluster whose configuration you want to update.

Specifies the external DNS servers that you want to expose to the workloads. These DNS servers serve as the default fallback DNS servers to resolve domain names hosted outside of the Supervisor Cluster.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the list of domains that you want to search when trying to look up a host name on the Tanzu Kubernetes API server specified in order of preference.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet modifies the configuration of a workload namespace.
This cmdlet modifies the configuration of a workload namespace. The cmdlet requires a connection to a vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the set of namespaces on which you want to to apply the change of the configuration.
Specifies the new value of the description for the specified workload namespace.

Indicates that the command returns immediately without waiting for the task to complete. In this mode, the output of the cmdlet is a Task object. For more information about the RunAsync parameter, run "help About_RunAsync" in the VMware PowerCLI console.

Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the description of the workload namespace "MyNamespace" to "The new description text".
Sets the description of all workload namespaces that have a name matching the "Target*" pattern to "The new description text".
Sets the description of the workload namespace "MyNamespace" to be blank.

maml:description.maml:para: Changes the Kubernetes resource limits of a namespace.
Changes the Kubernetes resource limits of a namespace. If you want to remove a limit, specify $null to the respective parameter.
Specifies the namespace limits object that you want to change.
Sets or removes the maximum number of configuration maps for the namespace.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Sets or removes the maximum CPU resource for the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of daemon sets for the namespace.
Sets or removes the default CPU limit for a namespace. The default CPU limit is assigned to all new containers in that namespace, in case no CPU limit is explicitly specified.
Sets or removes the default CPU request for a namespace. The default CPU request is assigned to all new containers in that namespace, in case no CPU request is explicitly specified.
Sets or removes the default memory limit for the namespace. The default memory limit is assigned to all new containers in that namespace, in case no memory limit is explicitly specified.
Sets or removes the default memory request for the namespace. The default memory request is assigned to all new containers in that namespace, in case no memory request is explicitly specified.
Sets or removes the maximum number of deployments in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of jobs in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum memory resource for the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of persistent volume claims in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of pods in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of replica sets in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of replication controllers in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of secrets in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of services in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of stateful sets in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum storage resource for the namespace.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Sets or removes the maximum number of configuration maps for the namespace.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.

Sets or removes the maximum number of daemon sets for the namespace.

Sets or removes the default CPU request for a namespace. The default CPU request is assigned to all new containers in that namespace, in case no CPU request is explicitly specified.
Sets or removes the default memory limit for the namespace. The default memory limit is assigned to all new containers in that namespace, in case no memory limit is explicitly specified.
Sets or removes the default memory request for the namespace. The default memory request is assigned to all new containers in that namespace, in case no memory request is explicitly specified.
Sets or removes the maximum number of deployments in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of jobs in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum memory resource for the namespace.
Specifies the namespace limits object that you want to change.

Sets or removes the maximum number of pods in the namespace.

Sets or removes the maximum number of services in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum number of stateful sets in the namespace.
Sets or removes the maximum storage resource for the namespace.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the CPU usage limit of the "dev" namespace to 2000 Mhz.
Removes the CPU usage limit of the "dev" namespace.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet modifies the configuration of a storage claim used by a workload namespace.
This cmdlet modifies the configuration of a storage claim used by a workload namespace. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the storage claims whose configuration you want to change.
Specifies the new limit on the storage used by workloads running in the workload namespace using the corresponding storage policy. To remove the limit, specify $null.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Changes the limit on the storage used by the workload namespace "MyNamespace" using the storage policy "MyStoragePolicy" to 1000 MiB.
Removes the limit on the storage used by the workload namespace "MyNamespace" for all the storage policies currently used by this workload namespace.
